intro: Pavetta bowkeri var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth pavetta, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round berries. This species is often grown for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade.
